intro: Hookerina gardneri, commonly known as the Hooker's rock fig, is a flowering plant native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It is a small, shrub-like species that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Hookerina gardneri is notable for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its resilience to drought conditions. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing food and shelter for local wildlife.
